moves.11. a3 f6: ?! A computer mouse slip. I was pondering castling and Bf6 and somehow mis-clicked the mouse button.
moves.12... Kf8 13. Bc2 Bd7 14. Nh4 Be8 15. Ng: ! Bishop-f6 will prove to be a powerful piece on the a1-h8 diagonal.
moves.19... Ne7 20. Bf7:
66 min. remaining. 
White's Bishop is running out of moves.
moves.22. g4 Kg7: And Black castles-by-hand and the rooks are connected.
moves.23. gxf5 exf5 24. f3: ?! This move seems too slow for me.

46 min. remaining.
moves.25... dxe4:

moves.26. Ba2 Bxd4+ 27. Kh1 Bxb2 28. Rab1 Qd2: Curiously, chesscom's analysis states this as a slight error, preferring  Rc2.

White's rook are line up on the King-side for an attack while my f8-Rook is tied down guarding the f7-square. 
time remaining: 35 min.
moves.31. Bb3 Rb2 32. Be6:
!!
White's pieces appear poised for a counter attack.
moves.36. Red1 Qxg2+: Assessing the position and time controls I forced trades to enter into an endgame which seem favorable for Black.
moves.37. Qxg2 Rxg2 38. Kxg2 Kxe6 39. Rfh1 Nh4: Again, a force of trades to enter the endgame.
